Package RelationBinaire

Interface Relation<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the elements of the relation
All Known Implementing Classes:
MathsRelation
public interface Relation<T>
This interface represents a binary relation in mathematics. It is used to represent a relation between two sets of objects.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    <T> boolean
    contient(Couple<T> cpl)
    This method returns the cardinal of the relation (the number of elements in the relation).
    <T> Set<Couple<T>>
    elements()
    This method returns the elements of the relation.
    boolean
    estAntisymetrique()
    This method checks if the binary relation is antisymmetric.
    boolean
    estReflexive()
    This method checks if the binary relation is reflexive.
    boolean
    estSymetrique()
    This method checks if the binary relation is symmetric.
    boolean
    estTransitive()
    This method checks if the binary relation is transitive.
    String
    toString()
    This method returns the hash code of the relation.

  • Method Details

    • estReflexive

      boolean estReflexive()
      This method checks if the binary relation is reflexive. A relation R is reflexive if for all (a, b) in R, (a, a) and (b, b) is also in R.
      Returns:
      true if reflexive, false otherwise

    • estSymetrique

      boolean estSymetrique()
      This method checks if the binary relation is symmetric. A relation R is symmetric if for all (a, b) in R, (b, a) is also in R.
      Returns:
      true if symmetric, false otherwise

    • estAntisymetrique

      boolean estAntisymetrique()
      This method checks if the binary relation is antisymmetric. A relation R is antisymmetric if for all (a, b) and (b, a) in R, a == b.
      Returns:
      true if antisymmetric, false otherwise

    • estTransitive

      boolean estTransitive()
      This method checks if the binary relation is transitive. A relation R is transitive if for all (a, b) and (b, c) in R, (a, c) is also in R.
      Returns:
      true if transitive, false otherwise

    • contient

      <T> boolean contient(Couple<T> cpl)
      This method returns the cardinal of the relation (the number of elements in the relation).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements of the relation
      Parameters:
      cpl - the couple to check
      Returns:
      the cardinal of the relation

    • elements

      <T> Set<Couple<T>> elements()
      This method returns the elements of the relation.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements of the relation
      Returns:
      the elements of the relation

    • toString

      String toString()
      This method returns the hash code of the relation.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the hash code of the relation
